clusterList.phrase: when i originally wrote the song my life i was trying to think back on events that affected my life and how they changed me i remember when proof died vividly and now every time i think about going to detroit i get depressed

my father is a big music fan and would buy new albums every couple weeks he'd put them on in the house and the words to the songs would get stuck in my head before i knew it i was memorizing lyrics and melodies and would hum them everywhere as time went on the love of music just grew and i realized i had a knack for coming up with my own melodies
once i fell in love with writing songs and making music my mind was made up
writing and recording these songs gave me an outlet for processing those things but also provided moments of hope and perseverance as well
the passion always burns in you and it was running through me for all these years
you made such a fool of yourself just to finish my song that's when i knew it was true love
i was so touched by the value of creativity and for him it was all about the value of musical creativity
over the years writing music has been so autobiographical
i still consider music as performing telling stories as well as playing music i have a hard time standing still

it's music from the heart and the mind i love music that makes me think about things when you hear a song that offers a new insight or a different take on an issue that's good stuff it can change your thinking it can change something in your life
